item.title: Report I-2024080116
item.description:
Report I-2024080116

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINIBULK INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was scheduled to deliver a shipment of sodium hypochlorite to Dieters Industrial. During the delivery the connection trailer pump line broke. The driver was next to the truck monitering the offoloading procedure and they quickly turned of the air and the internal mechinism stopping the flow of material. PVS spill response was dispatched to the site to neurtalize, contain and clean up the spill.

item.title: Report X-2024081940
item.description:
Report X-2024081940

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER REPORTED TO DR 617. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR CORROSIVE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE FLOOR IN THE TRAILER. BOX WAS WET ON BOTTOM CORNER. NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024080675
item.description:
Report E-2024080675

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-27
  • City: NEW COLUMBIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Lewis Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the top of the drum and estimated that one (1) ounce of material was released. Lewis Environmental personnel wiped down the drums. The impacted rags were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization
